snippet: An analyst says insiders are selling shares as a lockup period comes to an end after the stock’s public offering last November.
abstract: Shares of Twitter go into free fall, dropping 17.8 percent to close at $31.85, their lowest level since company's initial public offering in November 2013; market watchers say plunge is due to fact that early investors and company insiders began selling their shares after they became eligible to do so for the first time.

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and VINDU GOEL

lead_paragraph: An analyst says insiders are selling shares as a lockup period comes to an end after the stock’s public offering last November.

headline.main: Twitter Plunges as More Shares Hit Market
headline.print_headline: Twitter Plunges as More Shares Hit Market
